info.title: Checkout.com API Reference
info.description: # Introduction Checkout.com provides a collection of APIs that enable you to process and manage payments. Our APIs accept and return JSON in the HTTP body and return HTTP response codes to indicate errors. You can consume the APIs directly using your favorite HTTP/REST library or make use of one of our SDKs. Our unified payments API allows you to accept payments from cards, digital wallets and the most popular alternative payment methods, as well as pay out to a variety of destinations, all using the same integration. And with our webhook management, events and disputes APIs, you can keep on top of your transactions and react to any chargebacks, keeping your business running smoothly. # Authentication When you sign up for an account, you are given a secret and public API key pair. You authenticate with our API by providing the appropriate key in the request Authorization header. Never share your secret keys. Keep them guarded and secure.

address_line1.description: The first line of the address

address_line2.description: The second line of the address

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the address

address_line1.description: The first line of the address

address_line2.description: The second line of the address

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the address

id.description: Batch identifier

file_id.description: The identifier of the batch file previously uploaded via the [Files API](#tag/Files)

action.description: The action to be performed against the batch

reference.description: Your reference for the batch. If provided, this will be validated against the batch file's header

id.description: Batch identifier

phone.description: The customer's phone number

metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about a customer. You can include a maximum of 10 key-value pairs. Each key and value can be up to 100 characters long.

The ID of the retrieved instrument

instruments.title: Instrument
instruments.description: The details of the instruments linked to this customer

email.description: The email address of the customer

metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about a customer. You can include a maximum of 10 key-value pairs. Each key and value can be up to 100 characters long.

UpdateCustomerRequest.description: The customer attached to the instrument

id.description: The dispute identifier. This is the same as the payment action ID

category.description: The reason for the dispute. [Find out more](https://docs.checkout.com/risk-management/disputes#Disputes-Disputereasonsandrecommendedevidence)

amount.description: The amount that is being disputed, in the processing currency

reason_code.description: The reason code provided by the card scheme

status.description: The current status of the dispute

resolved_reason.description: If the dispute is automatically resolved, `resolved_reason` will contain the reason why it was resolved

relevant_evidence.description: This list and the dispute categories will change over time. Your evidence logic should be informed by this field, not hard coded.

evidence_required_by.description: The deadline by which to respond to the dispute. This corresponds to `received_on` + `n`, where `n` is a number of calendar days set by the scheme/acquirer

received_on.description: The date and time at which the dispute was issued

last_update.description: The date and time at which the dispute was last updated

id.description: The payment identifier

amount.description: The amount that is being disputed, in the processing currency

processed_on.description: The date and time at which the payment was requested

limit.description: The numbers of items to return

skip.description: The number of results to skip

from.description: The date and time from which to filter disputes, based on the dispute's `last_update` field

to.description: The date and time until which to filter disputes, based on the dispute's `last_update` field

statuses.description: One or more comma-separated statuses. This works like a logical *OR* operator

id.description: The unique identifier of the dispute

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment

payment_reference.description: An optional reference (such as an order ID) that you can use later to identify the payment. Previously known as `TrackId`

payment_arn.description: The acquirer reference number (ARN) that you can use to query the issuing bank

this_channel_only.description: If `true`, only returns disputes of the specific channel that the secret key is associated with. Otherwise, returns all disputes for that business

total_count.description: The total number of disputes retrieved (without taking into consideration skip and limit parameters)

id.description: The dispute identifier. This is the same as the action ID in the reconciliation API or the charge ID in the Hub.

category.description: The reason for the dispute. [Find out more](https://docs.checkout.com/docs/disputes#section-dispute-reasons-and-recommended-evidence)

status.description: The current status of the dispute

amount.description: The amount that is being disputed, in the processing currency

currency.description: The currency the payment was made in

payment_reference.description: An optional reference (such as an order ID) a merchant can use to later identify the charge. Previously known as TrackId

payment_arn.description: The acquirer reference number that can be used to query the issuing bank

evidence_required_by.description: The deadline by which to respond to the dispute. This corresponds to `received_on` + `n`, where `n` is a number of calendar days set by the scheme/acquirer

received_on.description: The date and time at which the dispute was issued

last_update.description: The date and time at which the dispute was last updated

proof_of_delivery_or_service_file.description: The file ID of the file you uploaded as a proof of delivery or service

proof_of_delivery_or_service_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link
proof_of_delivery_or_service_text.example: Delivery slip signed by the customer

proof_of_delivery_or_service_date_text.description: The date on which the item was delivered. You can also use this field to provide a link

file.description:
The path of the file to upload, and its type.
This must be a local path.

purpose.description: The purpose of the file upload. You must set this to `dispute_evidence`

FilePurpose.description: The list of file upload purposes. Currently this is only `dispute_evidence`

id.description: The file identifier

size.description: The size of the file upload object (in bytes)

uploaded_on.description: The date and time file was uploaded (in UTC)

download.description: The temporary file download URL. This expires after 60 minutes

id.description: The file identifier

proof_of_delivery_or_service_file.description: A file containing proof of delivery of goods or services

proof_of_delivery_or_service_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link

invoice_or_receipt_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link

invoice_showing_distinct_transactions_fi.description: A file containing invoice showing two distinct transactions

invoice_showing_distinct_transactions_te.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link
invoice_showing_distinct_transactions_te.example: Copy of invoice #1244 showing two transactions

customer_communication_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link
customer_communication_text.example: Copy of an email exchange with the cardholder

refund_or_cancellation_policy_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link

recurring_transaction_agreement_file.description: A file containing the recurring transaction agreement

recurring_transaction_agreement_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link
recurring_transaction_agreement_text.example: Copy of the recurring transaction agreement

additional_evidence_file.description: A file containing additional supporting documents

additional_evidence_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link

proof_of_delivery_or_service_date_file.description: A file showing the delivery date of the provided service/merchandise

proof_of_delivery_or_service_date_text.description: A brief text description of the file. You can also use this field to provide a link
proof_of_delivery_or_service_date_text.example: Copy of the customer receipt showing the merchandise was delivered on 2018-12-20

id.description: The payment unique identifier

action_id.description: The unique identifier for the action performed against this payment

currency.description: The currency in which the payment was made (three-letter ISO code)

approved.description: Whether the payment request was approved

auth_code.description: The acquirer authorization code, if the payment was authorized.

3ds.description: Provides 3D Secure enrollment status if the payment was downgraded to non-3D Secure

flagged.description: Whether the payment was flagged by a risk check

customer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

processed_on.description: The date/time the payment was processed

reference.description: Your reference for the payment

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a payment. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format.

webhooks-retry.description: A link to retry all of the webhooks configured for the event

EventLinks.description: The links related to the event

version.description: Determines the version of the event sent

notifications.description: The notifications (e.g., webhooks) that have been sent for the event

id.description: The event identifier

content_type.description: The content type of the data sent to the endpoint

attempts.description: The notification events ordered by timestamp in descending order (latest first)

retry.description: A link to retry the notification to the configured webhook

_links.description: The links related to the notification

status_code.description: The HTTP status code returned from the target server

response_body.description: The response body returned from the target server

send_mode.description: Whether the notification was sent automatically or requested manually

timestamp.description: The date/time the attempt was made

_links.description: The links related to the notification

amount.description: The payment amount. The exact format depends on the currency

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment, such as an order number

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for new customers

phone.description: The customer's phone number. This will override the phone number specified during tokenization

price.description: Minor units. Includes tax, excludes discounts. The exact format depends on the currency

products.description: Details about the products in the order

success_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default success redirect URL configured on your account

cancel_url.description: The URL to which the customer should be directed if they cancel the payment

failure_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default failure redirect URL configured on your account

metadata.title: The Metadata Schema
metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about the transaction. This object only allows one level of depth, so cannot accept non-primitive data types such as objects or arrays.

enabled.description: Whether to process this payment as a 3D Secure payment

attempt_n3d.description: Determines whether to attempt a 3D Secure payment as non-3D Secure should the card issuer not be enrolled

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment, such as an order number

_links.description: The links related to the hosted payment

billing_address.description: The billing address of the account holder

phone.description: The phone number of the account holder

id.description: The identifier of an existing customer

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers.

phone.description: The customer's phone number. This will only set the phone number for *new* customers.

default.description: If true, this instrument will become the default for the customer. If a *new* customer is created as a result of this request, the instrument will automatically be the default.

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment source or destination that can be used later for payments

type.description: The underlying instrument type (for instruments created from Checkout.com tokens, this will reflect the type of instrument that was tokenized)

fingerprint.description: A token that can uniquely identify this instrument across all customers

last4.description: The last four digits of the card number

bin.description: The card issuer's bank identification number (BIN)

issuer.description: The name of the card issuer

issuer_country.description: The card issuer's country (two-letter ISO code)

email.description: An email address to associate with the customer

metadata.title: The Metadata Schema
metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about the transaction. This object only allows one level of depth, so cannot accept non-primitive data types such as objects or arrays.

enabled.description: Whether to process this payment as a 3D Secure payment

attempt_n3d.description: Determines whether to attempt a 3D Secure payment as non-3D Secure should the card issuer not be enrolled

return_url.description: If provided, the success page will include a button that redirects your customer to the provided URL

id.description: The request id

expires_on.description: The date and time when the payment link expires

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment, such as an order number

_links.description: The links related to the hosted payment

downgraded.description: Inidicates whether this was a 3D Secure payment downgraded to non-3D Secure (when `attempt_n3d` is specified)

enrolled.description:
Indicates the 3D Secure enrollment status of the issuer
  * `Y` - Issuer enrolled
  * `N` - Customer not enrolled
  * `U` - Unknown

signature_valid.description: Verification to ensure the integrity of the response

authentication_response.description:
Indicates whether or not the cardholder was authenticated
  * `Y` - Customer authenticated
  * `N` - Customer not authenticated
  * `A` - An authentication attempt occurred but could not be completed
  * `U` - Unable to perform authentication

cryptogram.description: Base64 encoded cryptographic identifier (CAVV) used by the card schemes to validate the integrity of the 3D secure payment data

xid.description: Unique identifier for the transaction assigned by the MPI

version.description: Indicates the version of 3D Secure that was used for authentication

exemption.description: Specifies an exemption reason so that the payment is not processed using 3D Secure authentication

downgraded.description: Indicates whether this was a 3D Secure payment downgraded to non-3D-Secure (when `attempt_n3d` is specified)

enrolled.description:
Indicates the 3D Secure enrollment status of the issuer
  * `Y` - Issuer enrolled
  * `N` - Customer not enrolled
  * `U` - Unknown

enabled.description: Whether to process this payment as a 3D Secure payment

attempt_n3d.description:
Determines whether to attempt a 3D Secure payment as non-3D Secure
should the card issuer not be enrolled

eci.description: The Electronic Commerce Indicator security level associated with the 3D Secure enrollment result. Required if using a third-party merchant plug-in (MPI)

cryptogram.description: A Base64 encoded cryptographic identifier (CAVV) used by the card schemes to validate the cardholder authentication result (3D Secure). Required if using an external MPI

xid.description: The 3D Secure transaction identifier. Required if using an external MPI with 3D Secure 2.X.X and a Mastercard card, or with 3D Secure 1.X.X for any supported card scheme

version.description: Indicates the version of 3D Secure that was used for authentication. Defaults to 1.0.0 if not provided

exemption.description: Specifies an exemption reason so that the payment is not processed using 3D Secure authentication. Learn more about exemptions in our SCA compliance guide.

name.description: A dynamic description of the charge

city.description: The city from which the charge originated

BillingDescriptor.description: An optional dynamic billing descriptor displayed on the account owner's statement

action_id.description: The unique identifier for the capture action

reference.description: Your reference for the capture request

payment.description: The URI of the payment to be captured. Use this to check the status of the payment

redirect.description: For some alternative payments, the URI that the customer should be redirected to to complete the capture

_links.description: The links related to the capture

amount.description: The amount to capture. If not specified, the full payment amount will be captured

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this capture request

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the capture request. This can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

sku.description: The stock-keeping unit (SKU) identifier of the item

name.description: The name of the item or product

description.description: A description of the item or product
description.example: The fastest, hardest batterang known to man

image_url.description: The URL of an image of the item or product

price.description: The unit price of the item or product in the minor currency unit

quantity.description: The number of the items purchased

shipping_cost.description: The shipping cost of the item

shipping_tracking_url.description: A URL to track the shipping status of the item

Item.description: The order line item or product that is being purchased

id.description: Payment unique identifier

requested_on.description: The date/time the payment was requested

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

payment_type.description: This must be specified for card payments where the cardholder is not present (i.e., recurring or mail order / telephone order)

reference.description: Your reference for the payment

3ds.description: Provides information relating to the processing of 3D Secure payments

flagged.description: Whether the payment was flagged by a risk check

risk.description: Returns the payments risk assessment results

id.description: The unique identifier of the customer. This can be passed as a source when making a payment

customer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

phone.description: The phone number associated with the shipping address

payment_ip.description: The IP address used to make the payment

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a payment. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

eci.description:
The final Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) security level used to authorize the payment. 
Applicable for 3D Secure, digital wallets, and network token payments

actions.description:
A summary of the payment's actions, 
returned when a session ID is used to get the payment details
A link to the payment's associated actions

void.description: A link to void the payment, where applicable

capture.description: A link to capture the payment, where applicable

refund.description: A link to refund the payment, where applicable

_links.description: The links related to the payment

id.description: The payment's unique identifier

reference.description: Your reference for the payment request

customer.description: The customer associated with the payment, if provided in the request

redirect.description: The URI that the customer should be redirected to in order to complete the payment

_links.description: The links related to the payment

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment action

processed_on.description: The date/time the action was processed

auth_code.description: The acquirer authorization code for cards

reference.description: Your reference for the action

retrieval_reference_number.description: A unique identifier for the authorization that is submitted to the card scheme during processing

acquirer_reference_number.description: A unique identifier for the capture that is submitted to the card scheme during processing

acquirer_transaction_id.description: A unique identifier for the transaction generated by the acquirer

processing.description: Returns information related to the processing of the payment

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an action

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment action
The OpenPay account identifier

amount.description: The amount to be credited to the destination in the major currency unit

account_number.description: The first six digits and the last four digits of the primary recipient's card, without spaces, or up to ten digits of the primary recipient's account number

zip.description: The first part of the UK postcode (e.g., W1T 4TJ would be W1T)

PaymentRecipient.description: Information about the recipent of the payment's funds. Relevant for both [Account Funding Transactions](https://docs.checkout.com/payment-actions/account-funding-transactions) and VISA or MasterCard [domestic UK transactions processed by Financial Institutions](https://docs.checkout.com/risk-management/requirements-for-financial-institutions).

amount.description: The payment amount. The exact format depends on the currency. Omit the amount or provide a value of `0` to perform a card verification.

payment_type.description: This must be specified for card payments where the cardholder is not present (i.e., recurring or mail order / telephone order)

merchant_initiated.description: Flags the payment as a merchant-initiated transaction (MIT). Must be set to `true` for all MITs.

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment, such as an order number. Required when processing via dLocal or Bambora.

capture.description: Whether to capture the payment (if applicable)

capture_on.description:
A timestamp (ISO 8601 code) that determines when the payment should be captured.
Providing this field will automatically set `capture` to true

id.description: The identifier of an existing customer.

email.description: The customer's email address. Providing this will create a new customer, unless you have already stored a customer with the same email.

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers

phone.description: The phone number associated with the shipping address

previous_payment_id.description: For payments that use stored card details, such as recurring payments – an existing payment identifier from the recurring series or the Scheme Transaction Id

success_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default success redirect URL configured on your account

failure_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default failure redirect URL configured on your account

payment_ip.description: The IP address used to make the payment. Required for some risk checks

aft.description: Indicates whether the payment is an [Account Funding Transaction](https://docs.checkout.com/payment-actions/account-funding-transactions)

country.description: The two-letter ISO code of the cardholder's country.

document.description: The customer's personal identification number. The identification required is country-specific. See the dLocal documentation for more information.

payer.description: Details about the customer. These details may differ from those of the cardholder.

count.description: The number of payments to be made in the installment plan.

dlocal.description: Processing information required for dLocal payments.

processing.description: Use the processing object to influence or override the data sent during card processing

metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about a transaction with custom fields and up to five user-defined fields (`udf1` to `udf5`), which can be used for reporting purposes. `udf1` is also used for some of our risk rules.

PaymentRequestDestination.description:
The destination of the payout.
Use to pay out to a card.

type.description:
The payment source type
*Note:* *To make a payment with full card details, you must be SAQ D PCI compliant*

PaymentRequestSource.description:
The source of the payment.
Use to request a payment.

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

approved.description: Whether or not the authorization or capture was successful

eci.description: The final Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) security level used to authorize the payment. Applicable for 3D Secure, digital wallet, and network token payments

actions.description: A link to the payment's associated actions

void.description: A link to void the payment, where applicable

refund.description: A link to refund the payment, where applicable

id.description: The customer's unique identifier. This can be passed as a source when making a payment

PaymentResponseCustomer.description: The customer to which this payment is linked

id.description:
The payment source identifier that can be used for subsequent payments.
For new sources, this will only be returned if the payment was approved

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

type.description:
The payment source type. For any payment request sources that result in a card token (token, source ID, etc.),
this will be `card`; otherwise it will be the name of the alternative payment method

id.description:
The payment source identifier that can be used for subsequent payments.
For new sources, this will only be returned if the payment was approved

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

amount.description: The payment amount. The exact format depends on the currency. Omit the amount or provide a value of `0` to perform a card verification.

payment_type.description: This must be specified for card payments where the cardholder is not present (i.e., recurring or mail order / telephone order)

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this payment, such as an order number

capture.description: Whether to capture the payment (if applicable)

capture_on.description:
A timestamp (ISO 8601 code) that determines when the payment should be captured.
Providing this field will automatically set `capture` to true

id.description:
The identifier of an existing customer. If neither customer `id` nor `email` is provided, then 
a new customer will be registered

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers

phone.description: The phone number associated with the shipping address

previous_payment_id.description: For payments that use stored card details, such as recurring payments – an existing payment identifier from the recurring series or the Scheme Transaction Id

success_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default success redirect URL configured on your account

failure_url.description: For redirect payment methods, this overrides the default failure redirect URL configured on your account

payment_ip.description: The IP address used to make the payment. Required for some risk checks

reference.description:
Merchant's unique customer ID.
Alphanumeric characters only.

state.description: The state or province of the address country (ISO 3166-2 code of up to three alphanumeric characters).

country.description: The address country (two-letter ISO country code).

postalCode.description:
The post/zip code.
Only required for Mastercard transactions.

senderInformation.description: Allows you to send additional data required for Visa Direct Original Credit Transaction (OCT) and Mastercard Moneysend payments. Only required when sending transactions on behalf of another person or business. See our documentation for specific requirements.

processing.description: Use the processing object to influence or override the data sent during card processing

metadata.description: Allows you to store additional information about a transaction with custom fields and up to five user-defined fields (`udf1` to `udf5`), which can be used for reporting purposes. `udf1` is also used for some of our risk rules.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the refund request. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

token.description: The Checkout.com token (e.g., a card, wallet or token)

last_name.description: The payout destination owner's last name

billing_address.description: The payout destination owner's billing address. This will override the billing address specified during tokenization

phone.description: The payout destination owner's phone number. This will override the phone number specified during tokenization

phone.description: The payout destination owner's phone number

token.description: The Checkout.com token (e.g., a card or digital wallet token)

billing_address.description: The customer's billing address. This will override the billing address specified during tokenization

phone.description: The customer's phone number. This will override the phone number specified during tokenization

id.description: The payment source identifer (e.g., a card source identifier)

cvv.description: The card verification value/code (for card sources). 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits)

expiry_month.description: The expiry month of the card

expiry_year.description: The expiry year of the card

cvv.description: The card verification value/code. 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits)

stored.description: This must be set to `true` for payments that use stored card details

billing_address.description: The billing address of the cardholder

phone.description: The phone number of the cardholder

id.description: The customer's identifier.

expiry_month.description: The expiry month of the token

expiry_year.description: The expiry year of the token

cryptogram.description: The Base64 encoded cryptographic identifier (TAVV) used by card schemes to validate the token verification result. Optional if `previous_payment_id` is specified and `3ds.enabled` is false

eci.description: The Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) security level associated with the token. Optional if `previous_payment_id` is specified and `3ds.enabled` is false

stored.description: This must be set to `true` for payments that use stored card details

cvv.description: The card verification value/code. 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits)

phone.description: The customer's phone number

number.description: The LATAM local card scheme card number (without separators)

integration_type.description: The type of the integration. A redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

country.description: Payer's country code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

document.description: Payer's document identifier in Colombia, namely, Cédula de Ciudadanía (CC).

payment_country.description: The 2-letter ISO country code of the country in which the payment instrument is issued/operated.

language.description: The 2-letter ISO language code that should be preferred when presenting payment pages to the consumer.

integration_type.description:
Payment method integration type (platform wise)  
* web:  
  Payment requested for a purchase via a web browser.  
  In case of successful creation, the request will return a QR code string and a transaction  
  reference number (of the newly created corresponding BenefitPay transaction).  
  The QR code string should be used to generate a QR code, which then should be displayed  
  to the user for scanning using the BenefitPay app.  
* mobile:  
  Payment requested for a purchase via an iOS / Android app.  
  In case of successful creation, the request will return a transaction reference number.  
  The reference number should be used to request a transaction creation via the Android SDK  
  or the iOS SDK of BenefitPay.

The type of the integration:
  - `direct`: a ticket object is returned, which a merchant can use to render a ticket to a customer; no redirect url is returned
  - `redirect`: a redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

country.description: Payer's country code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

document.description: Payer's document identifier in Brazil, namely, Cadastro de Pessoas Físicas (CPF) or Cadastro Nacional da Pessoa Jurídica (CNPJ).

purpose.description: Purpose of the payment as appearing on customer's bank statement.

customer_profile_id.description: The customer's id within merchant's system.

expires_on.description: The date on which the payment expires.

price.description: The price of the item.  Expressed using Checkout.com's standard rules for calculating payment values.

purpose.description: Purpose of the payment as appearing on customer's bank statement.

label.description: Additional information field which is shown on the payment form (label)

text.description: Additional information field which is shown on the payment form (text)

description.description: Description of the product(s) or services being paid for.  This field must not contain characters that can lead to problems (for example those occurring in HTML editing codes).  To prevent any possible errors most iDEAL systems will reject any description that contains HTML-tags and such other code.

bic.description: BIC (8 or 11-digits). In iDEAL-lingo this is also called issuerID

language.description: This field enables the Issuer's site to select the Consumer's preferred language  (e.g. the language selected on the Merchant's site), if the Issuer's site supports this.  Code list in accordance with ISO 639-1. (Dutch = 'nl', English = 'en').  If a non-supported or non-existing language is entered the standard language of the Issuer is used. It is recommended to use 'nl' by default since not all Issuers support other languages.

authorization_token.description: Klarna authentication token, obtained by the merchant during client transaction authorization.

locale.description: RFC 1766 customer's locale. Optional, default taken from business settings.

purchase_country.description: ISO 3166 alpha-2 purchase country. Optional, default taken from business settings.

auto_capture.description: Allow merchant to trigger auto capturing.

billing_address.description:
Customer's billing address.  
This object is passed directly to Klarna as `billing_address`, 
so for the object definition use the [Klarna documentation](https://developers.klarna.com/api/#payments-api__create-a-new-order__billing_address).

shipping_address.description:
Customer's shipping address.  
This object is passed directly to Klarna as `shipping_address`, 
so for the object definition use the [Klarna documentation](https://developers.klarna.com/api/#payments-api__create-a-new-order__shipping_address).

tax_amount.description: Total tax amount of the order.

products.description:
The applicable order lines.  
This object is passed directly to Klarna as `order_lines`, 
so for the object definition use the [Klarna documentation](https://developers.klarna.com/api/#payments-api__create-a-new-order__order_lines).

customer.description:
Information about the liable customer of the order.  
This object is passed directly to Klarna as `customer`, 
so for the object definition use the [Klarna documentation](https://developers.klarna.com/api/#payments-api__create-a-new-order__customer).

merchant_reference1.description: Used for storing merchant's internal order number or other reference.  If set, will be shown on the confirmation page as "order number" (max 255 characters).

merchant_reference2.description: Used for storing merchant's internal order number or other reference (max 255 characters).

attachment.description:
Additional purchase information required for some industries.  
This object is passed directly to Klarna as `attachment`, 
so for the object definition use the [Klarna documentation](https://developers.klarna.com/api/#payments-api__create-a-new-order__attachment).

language.description: This field enables the issuer's site to select the consumer's preferred language (e.g. the language selected on the merchant's site), if the issuer's site supports this. Code list in accordance with ISO 639-1. (Arabic = 'ar', English = 'en'). Note that 'ar' corresponds to 'ARA' and 'en' to 'USA' values accepted by KNet Gateway

user_defined_field1.description: User-defined field that can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed

user_defined_field2.description: User-defined field that can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed

user_defined_field3.description: User-defined field that can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed. Note that this field must be omitted when the `card_token` field is not empty. This restriction exists because a card token is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 3

user_defined_field4.description: User-defined field that can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed.

user_defined_field5.description: User-defined field that can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed. Note that this field must be omitted when the ptlf field is not empty. This restriction exists because a PTLF value is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 5

card_token.description: This token allows re-use of card details for multiple payments. This 8-digit token should be generated by a merchant. When a subsequent payment is initialized with the same card token, a customer is presented with two options. The customer can choose to pay with KFast (doesn't need to enter card details again), or with KNet as usual. The payment flow stays the same i.e. a merchant should redirect a customer to the redirect URL which is provided in the payment creation response. Note that `user_defined_field3` must be omitted when the `card_token` field is not empty. This restriction exists because a card token is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 3

ptlf.description: This is an ID for merchant PTLF functionality tracking. Only alphanumeric characters are allowed. Note that `user_defined_field5` must be omitted when the `ptlf` field is not empty. This restriction exists because a PTLF value is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 5

payment_country.description: The 2-letter ISO country code of the country in which the payment instrument is issued/operated.

integration_type.description:
The type of the integration:
  - `direct`: a ticket object is returned, which a merchant can use to render a ticket to a customer; no redirect url is returned
  - `redirect`: a redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

country.description: Payer's country code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

document.description: Payer's document identifier in Mexico, namely, Unique Population Registry Code (CURP).

payment_country.description: The 2-letter ISO country code of the country in which the payment instrument is issued/operated.

account_holder_email.description: RFC compliant email address of the account holder.

integration_type.description:
The type of the integration:
  - `direct`: a ticket object is returned, which a merchant can use to render a ticket to a customer; no redirect url is returned
  - `redirect`: a redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

country.description: Payer's country code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

document.description: Payer's document identifier in Argentina, namely, Documento Nacional de Identidad (DNI) or Clave Única de Identificación Tributaria (CUIT).

invoice_number.description: PayPal recommends using this field to associate transactions with your internal tracking IDs or invoice numbers;  populating the invoice ID field will help you pull transaction information at a later date using only your internal ID.

recipient_name.description: Person's name associated with the shipping address.

logo_url.description: A URL to your logo. Use a graphics format, such as .gif, .jpg, or .png.  The logo appears at the top of the cart review area. Host the image on a secure (https) server. Character limit: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters. Width: 190px Height: 60px

stc.description: These details are used by Paypal to perform a pre-transaction risk management evaluation. The property names should be the same one as agreed between the merchant and PayPal.

quantity.description: A numeric value greater than zero represents the quantity of purchased Item. The value is used for display purposes only and does not affect the total amount of the payment. The minimum allowed value is 1.

description.description: Alphanumeric string containing a description of the payment order. Note: The maximum allowed length of this property is 255 characters after UTF-8 URL encoding.

language.description: Alphabetic value representing the language of the interface displayed to customer at merchant site, and used as language for the payment description parameter.  PG will use this value to display the interface supporting selected language to the customer during the payment process.  Supported values are: En, Ar. The default value is En.

national_id.description: Alphanumeric value representing the national id of the customer performing the transaction. The maximum allowed length of this property is 32.

integration_type.description: The type of the integration. A redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment.

country.description: Payer's country code. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

document.description: Payer's document identifier in Argentina, namely, Documento Nacional de Identidad (DNI) or Clave Única de Identificación Tributaria (CUIT).

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. For example DE, FR, IT.

languageCode.description: The ISO 639-1 language code. For example de, fr, it.

last4.description: The last four digits of the card number

fingerprint.description: Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this to compare cards across customers

bin.description: The card issuer's Bank Identification Number (BIN)

issuer.description: The name of the card issuer

issuer_country.description: The card issuer's country (two-letter ISO code)

last4.description: The last four digits of the card number

fingerprint.description: Uniquely identifies this particular card number. You can use this to compare cards across customers.

bin.description: The card issuer's Bank Identification Number (BIN)

issuer.description: The name of the card issuer

issuer_country.description: The card issuer's country (two-letter ISO code)

avs_check.description: The Address Verification System check result

cvv_check.description: The card verification value (CVV) check result

fast_funds.description: The fast funds eligibility of the card. [Read more](https://docs.checkout.com/payment-actions/pay-out-to-a-card)

payment_account_reference.description: A unique reference to the underlying card for network tokens (e.g., Apple Pay, Google Pay)

dlocal_order_id.description: An ID used for tracking payments in dLocal.  The dLocal 'Order ID' will contain this value.

dlocal_payment_id.description: An ID returned from dLocal for a created payment.  The dLocal 'Payment ID' will contain this value. This value will not be available in the case of rejected payments.

integration_type.description: The type of the integration. A redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

iban.description: The IBAN of the Consumer Bank account used for payment (if applicable).

reference_number.description: Unique transaction reference number from BenefitPay

qr_data.description: String for generating the QR code to be scanned

error_code.description: Error code returned from BenefitPay.  For further detail, the full code meaning has to be requested directly from BenefitPay,  as CKO does not have access to this.

dlocal_order_id.description: An ID used for tracking payments in dLocal.  The dLocal 'Order ID' will contain this value.

dlocal_payment_id.description: An ID returned from dLocal for a created payment.  The dLocal 'Payment ID' will contain this value. This value will not be available in the case of rejected payments.

integration_type.description:
The type of the integration:
  - `direct`: a ticket object is returned, which a merchant can use to render a ticket to a customer; no redirect url is returned
  - `redirect`: a redirect url is returned, which the merchant redirects the customer to, to continue payment

number.description: Numeric code of the numeric or custom ticket

barcode.description: Code to be included in the barcode of the barcode or custom ticket

format.description: Format of the barcode of the BARCODE or CUSTOM ticket. For example, CODE_128, or ITF.

id.description: Reference code of the ticket

expiration_date.description: The expiration date of the ticket

company_name.description: Name of the company that acts as the beneficiary of the payment

provider_name.description: Name of the company/bank that is creating the ticket

provider_logo_url.description: URL of the logo of the company/bank that is creating the ticket

ticket_url.description: URL of the full version of the ticket

ticket.description: Ticket object. Returned only when the payment was submitted with integration_type as 'direct'.

purpose.description: Purpose of the payment as appearing on customer's bank statement.

bic.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC). It can be exactly 8 characters or 11 characters long.

iban.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) without whitespaces.

reference_number.description: The customer pays using this number at Fawry's outlets

purpose.description: Purpose of the payment as appearing on customer's bank statement.

bic.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC). It can be exactly 8 characters or 11 characters long.

iban.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) without whitespaces.

bic.description: BIC (8 or 11-digits) BIC of the bank where the Consumer account is held.  If governing law prevents Issuers outside the Netherlands from disclosing this information, field may be omitted.

iban.description: The IBAN of the Consumer Bank account used for payment.  If governing law prevents Issuers outside the Netherlands  from disclosing this information, field may be omitted.

account_holder.description: Name of the Consumer according to the name of the account used for payment.  In the exceptional case that the consumerName cannot be retrieved by the Issuer,  this is filled with 'N/A'.  If governing law prevents Issuers outside the Netherlands from disclosing this information, field may be omitted.

language.description: This field enables the Issuer's site to select the Consumer's preferred language (e.g. the language selected on the Merchant's site), if the Issuer's site supports this. Code list in accordance with ISO 639-1. (Arabic = 'ar', English = 'en'). NOTE: 'ar' corresponds to 'ARA' and 'en' - to 'USA' values accepted by KNet Gateway.

user_defined_field1.description: User defined field can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed.

user_defined_field2.description: User defined field can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed.

user_defined_field3.description: User defined field can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed. Note that this field must be omitted when the card_token field is not empty. This restriction exists because a card token is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 3.

user_defined_field4.description: User defined field can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed.

user_defined_field5.description: User defined field can be used to pass and store any additional transaction data required to be archived with the transaction and available as a searching criteria. Only alphanumeric characters and spaces are allowed. Note that this field must be omitted when the ptlf field is not empty. This restriction exists because a PTLF value is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 5.

card_token.description: This token allows re-usage of card details for multiple payments. This 8-digit token should be generated by a merchant. When a subsequent payment is initialized with the same card token, a customer is presented with two options. The customer can choose to pay with KFast (doesn't need to enter card details again), or with KNet as usual. The payment flow stays the same i.e. a merchant should redirect a customer to the redirect URL which is provided in the payment creation response. Note that user_defined_field3 must be omitted when the card_token field is not empty. This restriction exists because a card token is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 3.

ptlf.description: This is an ID for merchant PTLF functionality tracking. Only alphanumeric characters are allowed. Note that user_defined_field5 must be omitted when the ptlf field is not empty. This restriction exists because a PTLF value is passed to KNet Gateway as user defined field 5.

knet_payment_id.description: The payment identifier assigned by KNet Gateway.

knet_result.description: The state of the payment, returned by KNet Gateway after the customer is redirected from the payment page.

inquiry_result.description: The state of the payment, retunrned by KNet Gateway in the response from the payment inquiry. This field is populated in rare cases when the redirection from the payment page did not occur properly.

bank_reference.description: The result transaction reference, given by some banks/institutions.

knet_transaction_id.description: The transaction identifier assigned by KNet Gateway.

auth_code.description: The resulting authorization code from the issuing bank.

auth_response_code.description: The auth response code / reason code relating to the issuing bank authorization code.

post_date.description: The transaction date in the authorization system format, with the value defined by the issuing bank, so may not match the actual transaction date. The format is `MMDD`.

avr.description: The Address Verification Response returned from the address verification service.

error.description: The KNET error code for transaction processing.

error_text.description: The KNET text detail for the error, including an error code.
error_text.example: IPAY0100044-Problem occured while loading payment page.

service_supplier_id.description: The identifier of a supplier charging for its service or product

dlocal_order_id.description: An ID used for tracking payments in dLocal.  The dLocal 'Order ID' will contain this value.

dlocal_payment_id.description: An ID returned from dLocal for a created payment.  The dLocal 'Payment ID' will contain this value. This value will not be available in the case of rejected payments.

status_message.description: A message giving further detail on the payment status, for failure/cancelled/success status payments.

confirmation_id.description: An identifier from the QPay gateway for a successful payment.

iban.description: IBAN of a payer, available when a payment is authorised.

bic.description: BIC of a payer, available when a payment is authorised.

account_holder_name.description: The name of a payer, available when a payment is authorised.

enabled.description: Whether a risk assessment should be performed

RiskRequest.description: Configures the risk assessment performed during the processing of the payment

action_id.description: The unique identifier for the void action

reference.description: Your reference for the void request

_links.description: The links related to the void

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify this void request

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the void request. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format

id.description: The unique payment identifier

action_id.description: The unique identifier for the void action

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the payment

processed_on.description: The date/time the void was processed

count.description: The number of payments included in the report

id.description: The unique payment identifier. This was previously called `transaction_id`

processing_currency.description: The currency of the payment when processed by the cardholder

payout_currency.description: The currency of the payment when paid out to you

requested_on.description: The date on which the payment was initiated

channel_name.description: The name of the channel from which the payment was initiated

reference.description: An optional identifier used for tracking payments. This was previously called `track_id`

issuer_country.description: The country of the issuing bank

merchant_country.description: The country of the merchant bank

mid.description: An optional, user-defined identifier for the business

type.description: The type of action administered to a payment

id.description: The unique identifier associated with an action (referred to as a charge ID in the Hub)

processed_on.description: The date on which the action occurred

response_code.description: The response code of the action (payment request)

response_description.description: Further information about the response code

type.description: Describes an amount or fee associated with an action. For example, a gateway fee, capture fee and capture amount would all be associated with the capture action

date.description: Specifies an associated date with a specific amount (some external fees are returned after the associated action)

processing_currency_amount.description: The associated amount in the processing currency (if applicable). Numerical values up to 8 decimal places are provided in the response

payout_currency_amount.description: The associated amount in the payout currency. Numerical values up to 8 decimal places are provided in the response

href.description: The direct link to the payment
This link allows you to move to the next page of results in the response. Responses are paginated at the payout level
This is a direct link to the response associated with the submitted request

count.description: The number of statements included in the report

id.description: The unique identifier of the generated statement

period_start.description: The start date of all transactions and amounts that are encompassed within the statement

period_end.description: The end date of all transactions and amounts that are encompassed within the statement

date.description: The date the statement was generated

carried_forward_amount.description: The amount carried forward before the statement period

current_period_amount.description: The total amount of transactions during the statement period

net_amount.description: The total amount paid out to your bank account

date.description: The date the payout was completed

id.description: Identifies the associated payment

payout _fee.description: The total fee charged for the payout

href.description: The direct link to the payout

payouts.description: The summary is a breakdown of your statement, ordered by the payout currency and its associated payout ID

ResourceId.description: The resource ID. Defaults to UUID v4

ServerTimestamp.description: Read-only UTC timestamp, automatically assigned by us

billing_address.description: The payment source owner's billing address

source_data.description: Additional data required to create SEPA payment sources

self.description: The URI of the payment source

cancel.description: A link to cancel the SEPA Direct Debit mandate

id.description: The unique identifier of the payment source that can be used later for payments

customer.description: The customer associated with the payment source if provided in the request

self.description: The URI of the payment source

reference.description: A reference you can later use to identify the source

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

id.description:
The identifier of an existing customer. If neither customer `id` or `email` is provided, then 
a new customer will be registered

email.description: An optional email address to associate with the customer

name.description: The customer's name. This will only set the name for *new* customers

customer.description: Details of the customer to associate with the source

id.description: The unique identifier of the customer

SourceResponseCustomer.description: The customer to which the payment source is linked

version.description: Version information about the payment token. The token uses `EC_v1` for ECC-encrypted data, and `RSA_v1` for RSA-encrypted data

data.description: Encrypted payment data. Base64 encoded as a string

signature.description: Signature of the payment and header data. The signature includes the signing certificate, its intermediate CA certificate, and information about the signing algorithm

header.description: Additional version-dependent information used to decrypt and verify the payment

signature.description: Verifies the message came from Google. The signature is created using ECDSA

protocolVersion.description: Identifies which encryption/signing scheme created this message. In this way, the protocol can evolve over time if needed. If it is not set, assume ECv0

signedMessage.description: A serialized JSON string containing the encryptedMessage, ephemeralPublicKey, and tag. To simplify the signature verification process, this value is serialized

expiry_month.description: The expiry month of the card

expiry_year.description: The expiry year of the card

cvv.description: The card verification value/code. 3 digits, except for Amex (4 digits)

phone.description: The payment source owner's phone number

issuer_country.description: The card issuer's country (two-letter ISO code)

type.description: The type of card details to be tokenized
The type of card details to be tokenized

expires_on.description: The date/time the token will expire

last4.description: The last four digits of the card number

issuer.description: The name of the card issuer

issuer_country.description: The card issuer country ISO-2 code

self.description: The URI of the payment source

content_type.description: The content type to be sent to the webhook endpoint

AccessForbidden.description: Access forbidden, invalid API-KEY was used

ckoIdempotencyKey.name: Cko-Idempotency-Key
ckoIdempotencyKey.description: An optional idempotency key for safely retrying payment requests

collectionExpand.name: expand
collectionExpand.description: Expand response to get full related object intead of ID.  See the expand guide for more info.

collectionFields.name: fields
collectionFields.description: Limit the returned fields to the list specified, separated by comma.  Note that id is always returned.

collectionFilter.name: filter
collectionFilter.description:
The collection items filter requires a special format.
Use "," for multiple allowed values.  Use ";" for multiple fields.
See the filter guide for more options and examples about this format.

collectionQuery.name: q
collectionQuery.description: The partial search of the text fields.

collectionSort.name: sort
collectionSort.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort).

rulesVersion.name: version
rulesVersion.description: The rule set version. Expand response to get full related object instead of ID.  See the expand guide for more info.

Cko-Request-Id.description: The unique identifier of the request

ApiPublicKey.description: Unless explicitly stated, all endpoints require authentication using your secret key. Public keys should only be used in JavaScript or native applications. You can find your API keys, and generate new ones, in your Hub account. #### Format - Sandbox `pk_test_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` - Production `pk_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`
ApiPublicKey.name: Authorization

ApiSecretKey.description: Unless explicitly stated, all endpoints require authentication using your secret key. Public keys should only be used in JavaScript or native applications. You can find your API keys, and generate new ones, in your Hub account. #### Format - Sandbox `sk_test_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` - Production `sk_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx`
ApiSecretKey.name: Authorization

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: Process and manage payments from a variety of sources and to various destinations all within one integration.

tags.name: Payment Links
tags.description: Create a Payment Link to accept and process payment details.

tags.name: Hosted Payments Page
tags.description: Create a Hosted Payments Page to accept and process payment details.

tags.name: Sources
tags.description: Create a payment source for a customer that you can use for one or more payments.

tags.name: Tokens
tags.description: Create a token that represents a card's details (or their tokenized form in a digital wallet) that you can later use to request a payment, without you having to process or store any sensitive information.

tags.name: Instruments
tags.description: Create a payment instrument that you can later use as the source or destination for one or more payments.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Create and manage the webhook notifications you receive to keep up to date with the status of your transactions.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Use events to monitor and get insights into your transactions.

tags.name: Disputes
tags.description: Keep track of and act on your open disputes (also known as chargebacks) to submit the best possible response.
